title: U.S. launches retaliatory strikes in Iraq and Syria
summary: The United States carried out airstrikes against Iran-backed militia targets in Iraq and Syria following a deadly attack on U.S. troops in Jordan.

title: El Salvador’s Bukele wins re-election in landslide
summary: President Nayib Bukele won re-election in El Salvador with an overwhelming majority, extending his tough anti-gang policies.

title: Russia captures Ukrainian town of Avdiivka
summary: Russian forces took control of Avdiivka after months of intense fighting, marking one of Moscow’s most significant gains in 2024.

title: Finland elects new president
summary: Former Prime Minister Alexander Stubb won Finland’s presidential election, defeating his rival in a closely watched runoff.

title: Indonesia begins voting in presidential election
summary: Millions of Indonesians cast ballots in a major presidential election expected to shape the country’s political and economic future.

title: Navalny death sparks international condemnation
summary: Western leaders condemned Russia following the death of opposition figure Alexei Navalny in a remote Arctic prison.

title: Farmers protest across Europe
summary: Farmers staged protests across several European countries over rising costs, environmental rules, and trade policies.

title: Nvidia reports record quarterly earnings
summary: Chipmaker Nvidia posted record revenues driven by strong demand for artificial intelligence hardware.

title: UN warns of worsening humanitarian crisis in Gaza
summary: The United Nations reported severe shortages of food and medical supplies in Gaza as fighting continued.

title: China launches new space mission
summary: China successfully launched a new satellite as part of its expanding space and navigation program.
